intro: Hetaeria lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate hetaeria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its root system is fibrous and can form dense colonies, contributing to soil stabilization. Hetaeria lanceolata is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
